body_html:
I have a description of the changes needed for MacOS GPU compilation at https://gist.github.com/MatthiasWinkelmann/41dd42b07f8bd794aa462f3b9712c018

https://github.com/MatthiasWinkelmann/tensorflow also contains the patches, but it's only updated every few months.

FWIW the changes are rather minor and have not changed much over the last few releases. So you may indeed be right that the Tensorflow dev team may want to consider supporting MacOS again. But if not (and there may be a support burden apart from the source changes needed) it has been much less of a problem than initially feared.

But if not (and there may be a support burden apart from the source changes needed) it has been much less of a problem than initially feared.
body:
I have a description of the changes needed for MacOS GPU compilation at https://gist.github.com/MatthiasWinkelmann/41dd42b07f8bd794aa462f3b9712c018

https://github.com/MatthiasWinkelmann/tensorflow also contains the patches, but it's only updated every few months.

FWIW the changes are rather minor and have not changed much over the last few releases. So you may indeed be right that the Tensorflow dev team may want to consider supporting MacOS again. But if not (and there may be a support burden apart from the source changes needed) it has been much less of a problem than initially feared.
